item.title: Unit 1 -- Mathematical Logic
item.description: Reference book DAY 1 21-02-2024 Propositions and Truth Table A proposition is a declarative sentence (i.e., a sentence that declares a fact) that is either true or false, but not both. Example: 1. Washington, D.C., is the capital of USA 2. Toronto is the capital of CANADA 3. 1+1=2 4. 2+2=3 Propositions 1 and 3 are true, whereas 2 and 4 are false. Truth Table Truth table is the representation of all the True and False values a statement has.
